name: Macdonald Bath Spa Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I took my husband here as a birthday treat, we are on a tight budget but I thought we deserved abit of a splurge having recently added to our family! Great location, sabout a 5 min nice walk into city centre.
reviews.title: Disappointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was tired and dreary, not the cleanest I have been in. In fact, the travel lodges we usually stay in are usually much nicer! bed was huge and comfy though.
reviews.title: One of the best hotels we have stayed in.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010
reviews.text: The spa was nice, and the outdoor pool lovely. Staff were, in the main friendly, however, in the spa treatment rooms (which were stunning) staff were not very helpful, we had to ask a few times in the 'relexation room' for water, and never did get any hot for a cuppa after our treatment!
reviews.title: Definitely not worth the price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The treatment itself was very poor, It did not last nearly as long as advertised, and the massage itself was really bad for both of us. I wasn't very happy as it was expensive.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel with Top Class Staff & Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel grounds are lovely, the hotel itself beautiful, until you get into the rooms! I cannot comment on the food as it was out of our budget!
reviews.title: A birthday treat!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having had a disastrous stay at the Macdonald Savill Court hotel (see my review) we were a little wary as to how this hotel would compare. We needn't have worried - it was a case of chalk and cheese!!
reviews.title: Very pleasant stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The key thing here, I think, is that the staff are REALLY well trained - always with a greeting and the excellent staff in the bar and the uber-efficient Edmund in the restaurant always calling us by name is something that is such a small detail but is hugely appreciated.
reviews.title: Have been before and will go again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was an "executive" room and while it was spacious was (as is mentioned by another reviewer) a little "tired". The bathroom, too, was spacious and well equipped (lovely heated towel rail) but also a bit tatty. These are purely cosmetic things which could be addressed with a minimum of decorating! It is supposed to be 5 star, after all.
reviews.title: 5 Star Hotel with 5 Star Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The spa is heavenly with a good pool and a stupendous outside pool which is actually a giant hot tub with steamy water and bubbles - we sat out here in the rain and it was great!! The treatment rooms are lovely and tranquil and the thermal suite is superb with steam, sauna, ice room and mood showers - definitely worth a visit. I must mention that the prices in the spa are pretty steep (the exact same treatments using the exact same products are CONSIDERABLY cheaper in other Macdonald hotels).
reviews.title: It was ok

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: The food was very good with breakfast being a mixture of buffet, for the cold items and waiter service for cooked items - so thankfully, none of that awful greasy mess that is the buffet breakfast!! We had dinner there on both nights and it was excellent with a good choice and attentive service.
reviews.title: Another lovley stay at The Bath Spa Hotel
So-So Experience at the Bath Spa
reviews.text: The Macdonald Bath Spa pitches itself - and is priced as, a high end 5* hotel. As such, I think guests - many of whom would be paying top money because of a special occasion (as we were) should expect nothing but the best. It was on this point that I must admit we were left a little disappointed with our weekend stay.

reviews.title: Tepid Bath Spa
reviews.text: The hotel itself was beautiful, and the grounds are well maintained. The decor in the rooms and the rest of the interior of the hotel was, to match a number of the other reviews on here, rather tired and ‘1980s’. However, the spa facilities are really fantastic, and, in my view, made up for the tired facilities elsewhere.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: For us, it was really the level of service which let the place down.
reviews.title: 5 star prices - 1 star service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 1) Meal in the Alfresco restaurant. Partner's pasta came out with a sauce which was clearly straight from a jar. I ordered salmon which came out raw in the middle. I will be clear here, I like my salmon pink - but the obviously fozen piece of fish was cold, and raw in the middle. I sent it back, and the same piece of salmon was returned to me 10 mintes later (complete with the fork marks from where I had cut it earlier), cooked through. The fact that the item was removed from our bill was not really good enough, given the fact this could have given me food posioning, not to mention that the main courses in this restaurant are very expensive (Mains typically around £20).
reviews.title: Overpriced. Rooms need a massive refurb but spa fantastic!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 2) Reception staff were not switched on at all: for example we asked to have our room cleaned as it had not been during the day. Lady nodded and smiled - but didn't think to ask which room we were in (we only realised as we were walking away and went back) so obviously had no intention of actioning our request. Same thing when we cancelled a reservation in the Vellore Restaurant for lunch - no one thought to write down our reservation details, just smiled and said they'd cancel it- so a couple of hours later we had a number of angry voicemails from the Vellore asking why we hadn't shown for lunch
reviews.title: very very poor, don't waste your money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: Over February half term, our family, with two boys aged 7 and 9, stayed in this comfortable, well appointed and convenient hotel, which is close (a very pleasant 15 minute walk down the hill) to the City. The hotel sits in a quiet country house style 6 acre garden, just above Sydney Gardens. Children are made to feel very welcome with a menu for them in the main dining room.
reviews.title: Comfortable hotel in a great setting with excellent pool, spa and gym

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We took two entry price level adjoining rooms on the ground floor. The rooms and bathrooms were very comfortable. The Spa has both indoor and outdoor pools of a very good size and also specialist rooms with excellent showers and changing rooms. The gym is one of the best I've found in a hotel with free weights as well as plenty of running machines etc.
reviews.title: Go for the Spa, stay somewhere else

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009
reviews.text: The public rooms are very pleasant and relaxing. I do think the management could lose the coin operated PC for the internet (very tight).
reviews.title: Don't waste your money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was an excellent buffet (in fact one of the best I’ve had) but you can order a la carte too. The evening meals were fine, though pricey, but after a few days you will prefer to eat in the City for a bit of variety.
reviews.title: Overpriced

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were very friendly, knowledgeable and helpful though sometimes a little forgetful with requests for more coffee, toast or the restaurant bill.
reviews.title: An excellent place for visiting Bath

likes.liked: — the staff, the rooms and the spa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in this hotel to have a relaxing weekend break - which it certainly was.
reviews.title: Most relaxing city break ever!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: On arrival our room wasn't ready but the staff were happy to look after our bags whilst we wandered into the city centre. It is a 15- 20 minute walk into the centre - up hill on the way back!
reviews.title: Lovely surrounds, great service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms are old fashioned and elegant - the whole hotel screams elegance!
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel - Wish we had stayed longer!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: Spa facilities are amazing - after walking around the city it was such a treat to get back and relax in the massive outdoor jacuzzi before heading inside to try out the other spa facilities, we particularly infra-red sauna and aromatherapy room. There is also a nice pool and you can book lots of spa treatments - we didn't because the complimentary facilities were so good and kept us busy!
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The restaurant is beautiful and breakfast was excellent - the bars are also really nice and cosy - although drinks are fairly expensive.
reviews.title: everything about this hotel was AMAZING!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wanted a romantic weekend away in a plush hotel and this hotel didn't let us down. Was open minded about some of the reviews on here as everyone has different expectations and obviously most people can have a bad day from time to time, but have to say... we were very impressed !
reviews.title: Most enjoyable weekend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008
reviews.text: We arrived early on a gorgeous sunny day and were more than happy to lose ourselves in the grounds until checkin time, but thought we'd ask if our room was ready anyway. We were greeted warmly and were told we could get in our room straight away.. Brilliant ! The room was lovely, very spacious and clean with luxury toiletries as advertised.
reviews.title: An Interesting Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had already pre booked Spa treatments for the afternoon but wanted to have some lunch first. The Concierge was very helpful and pointed out several eateries in the city centre for us to chose from. We found a nice cafe by the river and had our first taste of this beautiful city alongside the River Avon... Most pleasant.
reviews.title: A faultless experience
lovely big four poster bed
reviews.text: A gentle stroll back to experience our Spa treatments and other Spa facilities worked off our lunch and prepared us nicely for our treatments ( my first ! ).... which were great !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The remainder of our stay went very smoothly and staff were very attentive and helpful at all times. We never sampled the resteraunts, but breakfast was very nice with plenty of choice.
reviews.title: Excellent place - little on expensive side

likes.disliked: — Air conditioning very subjective to weather - often room quite warm

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I enjoyed a weekend away with my (now) Fiancée.
reviews.title: 5* - Good value in comparison

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: The hotel was excellent and in an ideal location for a nice short walk to the City Centre. About 15mins.
reviews.title: Romance vs. Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I went for a standard bedroom which was ample enough for us. Skysports on the TV and very comfortable bed and tastefully decorated bathroom with a hot towels.
reviews.title: Pleasure to return to this superb hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We used the Spa (which was free btw) and it was an excellent experience. The choice of treatments and spa rooms were adequate and the ice room was especially interesting and different.
reviews.title: So Romantic!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel staff were very attentive and did everything to make it efficient and hassle free.
reviews.title: Don't stay here!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I contacted the hotel directly to make the booking and confirmed a room with a king size bed. On arrival we were shown our room and were disappointed that the bed appeared smaller than a king. We inquired at the time whether it was indeed a king - this was confirmed. Obviously not a king size bed,, my husband contacted reception and was told that they do not have any even though they advertise King size on their website!!! The room itself was quite pleasant though we had to pass pallets and storage items and walk through the Alfresco Dining Room to get to the Reception area. Our location made us feel that we were in an isolation wing. Rooms 228=234 to be avoided at all costs.
reviews.title: Overpriced Accommodation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The outdoor heated pool which was one reason why we booked this hotel was out of action. My husband inquired whether it would be in use the following day and was told that they needed to bring the water up to temperature. On inspection, the builders were in and would be there for many days!!!!
reviews.title: great birthday treat

likes.liked: — the friendly staff and view from room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff were friendly and the inclusive Continental Breakfast was excellent. This is a 3/4 star hotel with inflated 5*+ prices!! We have stayed in better hotels for £100 per night whereas the minimum charge here is £150 and I feel sorry for anybody who paid even more than this.
reviews.title: fantastic return visit

likes.disliked: — won't be able to afford it again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I took my friend for her 65th birtday to this hotel. I was a little worrried by some of the previous reviews but I needn't of worried.
reviews.title: Great Anniversary Break!

likes.disliked: — View out of room but didnt really need a view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: I booked by email with the hotel and was pleased with the quick and positive responses to my requests.
reviews.title: has potential but a big let down

description: Country house hotel in restored Georgian mansion, set in acres of landscaped gardens; walking distance to city center.
